frame.name: Price_per_unit
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Product</fen> is offered by a <fen>Seller</fen> at a particular <fen>Price</fen> such that some total cost for the <fen>Buyer</fen> in the transaction is a multiple of the <fen>Price</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Descriptor">Additional</fex> <fex name="Product">telephone</fex> <fex name="Price">rates</fex> may apply.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Product
FE.definition:
<def-root>A commodity, item, or service being sold by the <fen>Seller</fen> at a certain <fen>Price</fen>.
<ex>The <t>rate</t> <fex name="Product">for second hand products</fex> is just too high.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Price
FE.definition:
<def-root>The amount of money that the <fen>Seller</fen> charges the <fen>Buyer</fen> for a <fen>Product</fen>.
<ex>She sells seashells at a <t>rate</t> <fex name="Price">of $20 per pound</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Seller
FE.definition:
<def-root>The entity that offers a <fen>Product</fen> at a certain <fen>Price</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Seller">Their</fex> <t>rates</t> are really low.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Buyer
FE.definition: <def-root>The person who purchases the <fen>Product</fen> at a particular <fen>Price</fen>. <ex>The <t>rate</t><fex name="Buyer">for you</fex> is going to be $15/month.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>A description of the <fen>Price</fen>, usually characterizing its position on a scale of expensiveness.
<ex>That company charges <fex name="Descriptor">ridiculous</fex> <t>rates</t>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: rate.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the scale along which the total cost of a transaction is calculated
